titleproper.value:
Guide to the Irish Center Club of New York Records
                    <num>AIA.023</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Rebecca Altermatt

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-03-28T15:58-0400</date>

unittitle.value: Irish Center Club of New York Records

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The collection contains correspondence, printed materials and membership information related to an effort to build an Irish Center in New York City in the 1940s. The purpose of the club was to promote Irish culture and arts.

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form: 
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; 
                <lb/>Archives of Irish America, Tamiment Library 
                <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library 
                <lb/>70 Washington Square South 
                <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.
Included among its Board of Directors and Officers were Paul O'Dwyer, Rose Cosgrove, Mrs. P.J. Gillespie, and John J. Bryne.

The collection contains articles of incorporation, correspondence, programs, and membership information related to an effort to build an Irish Center in New York City in the 1940s. The membership cards provide researchers a picture of prominent Irish Americans in New York City at the time.

subject.value: Irish Americans |x Social life and customs.
Irish Americans |z New York (State) |z New York |x Social life and customs.
